description: Largest unitary square divisor of n: if n=LLgggf (see A056192) and a(n)=LL, then its complementary divisor n/LL =gggf and GCD[L^2,n/LL]=1.
formula: a(n)=A008833[n]/A055229[n]^2 =K^2/g^2, which coincides with the largest square divisor iff the g-factor is 1.Multiplicative with a(p^e)=p^e for even e, a(p)=1, a(p^e)=p^(e-3) for odd e>1. - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Apr 30 2002
example: n=250: largest square divisor is 25, but is not unitary. GCD[25,10]=5=A055229(250)=g, so a(250)=25/g^2=1. The largest square and unitary divisor is here 1; n=200, A008833(200)=100, A055229(200)=g=GCD[100,2]=2 so a(200)=100/2^2=25 is already unitary because GCD[25,200/25]=1.
author: _Labos Elemer_, Aug 08 2000
